item.title: BMX Streets now available for PS5
item.content:encoded:
• PS5

Freestyle extreme biking simulation game comes to console.

Mash Games has released a PlayStation 5 version of freestyle extreme biking simulation game BMX Streets via PlayStation Store for $33.49 / £24.49 / €28.99, the developer announced.

BMX Streets first launched for PC via Steam on April 5, 2024.

Here is an overview of the game, via Mash Games:

About

BMX Streets is a next generation physics driven freestyle extreme biking simulator. BMX Streets captures the essence of BMX culture by giving players the ability to find their own style of riding through practice, experimentation, and exploration.

Key Features

  • Revolutionary Controls – Bumpers are your hands, triggers are your feet. BMX Streets puts you in complete control of your bike, whether its on the ground, in the air, or grinding down a handrail. The perfect balance of accessibility and depth, the control system allows you fully express yourself, from learning the basics to pushing the limits.
  • Physics Like No Other – BMX Streets physics make riding anything fun. Get technical on ledges and rails, send huge roof drops or thread your way around backyard bowls; it’s all about your style.
  • Endless Customization – Build your bike to match your style with over 1,000 bike parts. Build your dream bike that not only looks good, but lets your ride the way you want to.
  • Hit the Streets – BMX Streets‘ maps are built by riders for riders. Find your best line, session a new spot, and share your best tricks with replay editor.


https://www.gematsu.com/2026/02/bmx-streets-now-available-for-ps5
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Lyrical Games to publish new title from The Chinese Room
item.content:encoded:
The studio behind Still Wakes the Deep and more.

Lyrical Games has announced a publishing partnership with The Chinese Room, the British development student behind Still Wakes the Deep, Everybody’s Gone to the Rapture, and Vampire: The Masquerade – Bloodlines 2, the companies announced.

Lyrical Games is providing “full financing, strategic production support, and collaborative go-to-market planning” for the project, while The Chinese Room maintains its creative autonomy and intellectual property ownership.

“From our earliest conversations with The Chinese Room, it was immediately clear we had to back this strong vision for the world that they wanted to build,” said Lyrical Games head Blake Rochkind in a press release. “Now more than ever, our role as a publisher is to remove friction from their journey. We’re committed to providing them with clarity and resources so that they can focus on making this title truly exceptional.”

The Chinese Room CEO Ed Daly added, “Our partnership with Lyrical Games gives us the confidence and support to push creatively in the ways that are needed to stand out in today’s market. Now, we can focus on elevating the player experience while Lyrical ensures that the game reaches those players.”

Further information about the new game was not announced.



https://www.gematsu.com/2026/02/lyrical-games-to-publish-new-title-from-the-chinese-room
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Bluey’s Quest for the Gold Pen for PS5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, PS4, Switch, and PC launches May 28
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox Series

Currently available for Mac, iOS, and Android.

Story-driven adventure game Bluey’s Quest for the Gold Pen will launch both physically and digitally for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, PlayStation 4, Switch, PC via Steam on May 28, publisher PM Studios and developer Halfbrick announced. Physical edition pre-orders are available now through retailers such as Amazon and VGP.

Bluey’s Quest for the Gold Pen first launched for iOS and Mac on December 11, 2025, followed by Android on January 10, 2026.

Here is an overview of the game, via PM Studios:

About

Experience the world of Bluey as you never have before in this story-driven adventure game that only Bluey’s imagination can make possible! Join Bluey on her epic new quest across hand-drawn imaginary lands to retrieve the Gold Pen. Explore exciting worlds, complete fun challenges and trifficult puzzles, all as you embark on Bluey’s Quest for the Gold Pen. A world-first collaboration with the original Bluey creator.

Key Features

  • New Bluey Story – Dive into an adventure game fuelled by a brand-new story from the show’s creator! Discover the humour and warmth of Bluey brings in this fun new game for the family, with story by Joe Brumm.
  • Embark on a Heart-Warming Adventure – Bluey is drawing her imaginary world when Dad suddenly yoinks the Gold Pen she needs! Transported into Bluey’s hand-drawn imagination, Mum designs the imaginary lands, Dad rocks up on his cool bike as self-declared King Goldie Horns, and Bingo transforms into her honk-happy alter ego — Bingoose! Away they go on an exciting quest to retrieve the Gold Pen – and have heaps of fun along the way.
  • Go on Fun-Filled Quests – Uncover hidden treasures, solve puzzles, and discover playful mini quests as you glide, fly, and skate your way around all kinds of challenges and quests!
  • Discover Imaginary Hand-Drawn Worlds – Explore nine levels brimming with snowy mountains, dreamy golden beaches, lush green forests, and discover the Australian outback!
  • Fun for Everyone – Just like the animated series, Bluey’s Quest for the Gold Pen will spark laughter and encourage players of all ages to think and explore through play.

Watch a new trailer below.

Consoles and PC Release Date Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2026/02/blueys-quest-for-the-gold-pen-for-ps5-xbox-series-switch-2-ps4-switch-and-pc-launches-may-28

item.title: Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves DLC character Nightmare Geese launches February 26 alongside Street Fighter content update
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

The crossover continues.

Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves Season 2 downloadable content character Nightmare Geese will launch on February 26 alongside a free update that adds more Street Fighter collaboration content, SNK announced.

Here are the latest details, via SNK:

Nightmare Geese (voiced by Richard Epcar in English, Kong Kuwata in Japanese)

Former emperor of South Town. Revered by some, reviled by others, and targeted for revenge by a hungry few—a legend in his own right, even in the afterlife. Though no longer of this world, the horrors of Geese Howard remain a bane to all who knew him. His legacy is a testament to the power of one terrible truth: Legends never die. Their nightmare lives on…

New Stories in Episodes of South Town

Nightmare Geese’s single-player RPG adventure sees him roaming South Town, oblivious to how much time has elapsed since his death—or indeed if it even happened at all. Follow the specter as he traces the movements of individuals around him: those he knew in life and those who emerged after his demise.

Fatal Fury x Street Fighter: Round 3

The legendary crossover continues between Fatal Fury and Street Fighter! Rolling out at the same time as Nightmare Geese, this special free update includes:

  • Exclusive alternative outfits for Rock and Preecha, inspired by Street Fighter’s Luke and Juri.
  • A new Episodes of South Town where JP, the villain from Street Fighter 6, brainwashes Terry, and it’s up to Ken, Chun-Li, Rock, Jenet, and other fighters to put a stop to his reign of terror. Refrigerators from Street Fighter 6 also appear as special enemies!
  • New crossover skills that blend mechanics from Fatal Fury and Street Fighter to add a fresh change of pace.
  • A special boss: Kage Terry, a shadowy scourge that will put up a fearsome fight like no other.

Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, and PC via Steam and Epic Games Store.

Watch a new set of trailers below.

DLC Character Nightmare Geese Trailer

Japanese

Street Fighter Collaboration Update Trailer
